articles.title: Trump moves to designate Yemen's Houthis as 'foreign terrorist organization' amid tensions
articles.description: When former president Joe Biden took over from Trump in 2021, he removed the designation that Trump had signed near the end of his first term

articles.author: CBC.ca
articles.title: First Nations leader apologizes, walks back support for Northern Gateway pipeline in B.C.
articles.description: The Union of B.C. Indian Chiefs said in a statement that the answer to the Northern Gateway pipeline from Alberta to the Pacific "is still no," after Alberta Premier Danielle Smith suggested reviving the project in light of U.S. President Donald Trump's threat of tariffs on Canadian exports.
articles.content:
The president of the Union of B.C. Indian Chiefs apologized Wednesday and walked back comments he made earlier this week suggesting he supported reviving the Northern Gateway pipeline project.
"I do not support resuscitating dead projects such as the... [4544 chars]

articles.author: CBS News
articles.title: Meta says it didn't force users to follow President Trump on Facebook and Instagram
articles.description: The company also said it was working to resolve an issue where some words, including "Democrats" and "Republican," were blocked from Instagram search.
articles.content: Meta is denying claims circulating on social media that it forced Facebook and Instagram users to follow President Trump's official accounts, saying the changes some users noticed were standard practices tied to the transition of the POTUS account fr... [5273 chars]

articles.author: New York Daily News
articles.title: Steve Bannon wins week-long delay of trial for 'We Build the Wall' crowdfunding scam
articles.description: Steve Bannon convinced a Manhattan judge Wednesday to let a "more aggressive" attorney defend him against charges similar to those President Trump pardoned him for and won a week-long delay of his upcoming trial.
articles.content:
Steve Bannon convinced a Manhattan judge Wednesday to let a “more aggressive” attorney defend him against charges similar to those President Trump pardoned him for and won a weeklong delay of his upcoming trial.

articles.title: Europe posts record year for clean energy use as Trump pulls US toward fossil fuels
articles.description: A record 47% of the European Union’s electricity now comes from solar and other renewables, a report Thursday said, in yet another sign of the growing gap between the bloc's push for clean energy and the new U.S.
